sentence.idiomatic: He did not hesitate to spend a fortune buying famous paintings from people.
Everyone can't understand why he would spend such a large sum of money to buy a car. Is he really that crazy about cars?
He has spent a fortune on his child's education.
Promotions, pay raises... who wouldn't look forward to these kinds of great things?
I got promoted. Everybody, dinner is on me.
This matter was dealt with so poorly that everyone feels he won't get a promotion.
The government has been cracking down on piracy for more than two months. It's no longer all talk but little action.
Less talk, more action! Don't be all talk but no action again, accomplishing nothing at all.
So far she has only gone to the gym once. It seems like her plan of losing weight this time is once again all talk but little action.

word.literal: to talk a lot but let others do all the work

sentence.idiomatic: All you do is just talking. If you have the ability, come and try it.

word.literal: to talk a lot but let others do all the work

sentence.idiomatic: You made me move this cabinet up the stairs by myself? You are just standing around talking and not doing anything to help!

word.literal: to talk a lot but let others do all the work

sentence.idiomatic: Leaders are always standing around talking but not taking any action. No matter how difficult the task is, all they have to do is to order others to do it.
These past few years all day long he has been going on about wanting to start a venture, but he hasn't taken any action.
When a child is shouting about wanting to go play at the playground, his parents have to take him.
Is there any use in only going on about wanting to become a writer? Up until now you still haven't written a single article.
Only when you thoroughly forget the hurt he has caused you then you can be happy again.
One significant failure made him completely give up his ideal of becoming a scientist.
Those companies that severely polluted the environment should be closed down completely.
It is too late to realize the importance of knowledge after you have already started working.
What realizations have you come to after seeing the changes of the past few years in your hometown?
People often only realize the value of a possession once it has been lost.
Why is the price of oil rising so rapidly recently?
He is really lucky. Not only did he get promoted, but also his salary quickly rose twice as much from what it was before.
If the price of electricity continues to rise so rapidly, we won't even be able to afford to use the air conditioning.
I will show you guys my cooking today.
He dances so well, just showing off a little bit has made everyone watched him very closely.
He thinks he sings well. Every time he goes to KTV he is always competing to show-off.
Although all his colleagues are all being negative about it, but he believes that his choice was correct.
He is only discouraging and negative to people. He doesn't encourage others at all.
As his friend, how come you are just standing there being negative? Why not give him a hand?
If you're like this, not sticking with it, how will you ever learn to play piano well?
She can't stick with things. In the end, she doesn't accomplish anything.
His victory stems from persistence. Anything he does, he preseveres in it.
After the holidays, the number of travelers drops remarkably.
The price of vegetables gradually fell after Spring Festival.
He caught the time when housing prices were falling last year and bought a villa.
Wow, another year has passed. I've once again completely wasted a year. This year I have got to plan ahead. Work hard, enjoy life.

Yeah, me too. This year, my most important plan is to learn English. I have decided to join an English tutorial class, memorize words from the dictionary every day, and read the English newspaper. I just won’t believe that I can’t learn it! Because of language problems, I have already missed out on several promotion opportunities.

Yikes, don’t make it sound so terrifying! Every year you would talk big but no actions. What is the use of only saying beautiful words? Last year didn’t you also make this kind of a resolution, and what was the result? You didn’t stick with it. A year went by and you didn’t accomplish anything. Look, my plan is very simple, just four words: I will quit smoking. I will smoke a little bit less every day. Over the year, I will be able to totally give it up.

Forget it! Yours is not a resolution at all. If you want to quit, you must give it up completely. If you say you’re not going to smoke, just don’t smoke. And then there’s you, going off about studying English. It’s not something you can do in just a few days. Show us any progress you’ve made! Anyhow, I think the two of you are just big talkers and no actions.

Hey, how can you say that about us? This time I’m really going to follow through on what I say. Last year it was that I wasn’t aware of the seriousness of the problem. But this year it’s different. Once I’ve learned English, who knows how many good opportunities will be waiting for me. You’re just bashing our ideas. Why don’t you tell us what plans do you have then?

word.literal: just talk while others do the work

sentence.idiomatic: And you know why I also think that you just talk big? You said we only talk about it but don’t do anything, but what about you? Last year you said you wanted to save your money to buy a house and get married. Now, how come we don’t see even a trace of a new house?

word.literal: to be unable to keep up with

sentence.idiomatic: You can’t blame that on me! No matter how much money I make I still won’t be able to keep up with the soaring housing costs. But, it’s all right. The government has already instituted a new policy, so maybe this year the housing prices will go back down. If I save up for another year this year, I should be able to buy one. But the horrible thing is that I have to tough it out for another year! Hey, this year when we go out to eat, you two can handle the bill.
My English studies are really expensive!
Yeah, and to quit smoking I also have to spend a lot of money.
Well! You two are not true friends! No matter what you have to spend, it still won't compare to the fortune I have to spend on buying a house.

character.pinyin: sān tiān dǎyú, liǎng tiān shàiwǎng

word.literal: to throw cold water on(derogatory meaning)
just talk while others do the work
fall after a rise; drop (of prices, etc.)
hard earned money; a big sum of money; a fortune
